children.value: This page contains the original design documentation and architectural decisions for Slide Forge, along with insights from implementation.
Slide Forge is a Python library for creating PowerPoint presentations. It is a wrapper around the python-pptx library, and provides a simple interface for creating presentations.
Input is a Tex file, with Beamer class.
Parse LaTeX into hierarchical Universal_Document structure
Build semantic understanding of document structure
Semantic element mapping (frames ‚Üí slides, itemize ‚Üí bullets, etc.)
Position assignment based on slide layout types
Image path resolution with source context
Smart text box positioning with fallbacks
Font size handling with proper Pt() units
Theme system with multiple PowerPoint themes
Enhanced LaTeX ‚Üí Extended Universal_Document ‚Üí Advanced PowerPoint
- LaTeX equations rendered as high-quality PNG images (300 DPI)
- Title, author, date, and documentclass extraction
- Proper unescaping of LaTeX special characters
- Smart PowerPoint placeholder usage across templates
: All elements were overlapping because they were positioned at the same coordinates.
: Calculates semantic positions based on layout type
: Separation of concerns is crucial. The mapper handles ‚Äúwhat goes where‚Äù while the builder handles ‚Äúhow to render.‚Äù
: Content was dumped into text boxes, causing ‚Äúdashed boxes‚Äù (PowerPoint‚Äôs default placeholders) to remain unused.
: PowerPoint layouts work best when you respect their native structure. Use placeholders first, fall back to positioned text boxes.
: Raw integers caused ‚Äúvalue must be in range‚Äù errors with python-pptx.

from pptx.util import Pt
p.font.size = Pt(font_size)  # Instead of p.font.size = font_size
: python-pptx has specific unit requirements. Always use the provided utility functions.
: Images were looked for in the wrong directory (project root instead of LaTeX file directory).
: Pass source path through the conversion chain:
: Context matters. The builder needs to know where the source file was located to resolve relative paths.
: Content mapper calculates positions based on layout constants:

MARGIN_LEFT = 1.0
MARGIN_TOP = 2.5  # Below title
ELEMENT_SPACING = 0.4
CONTENT_WIDTH = SLIDE_WIDTH - MARGIN_LEFT - MARGIN_RIGHT
: LaTeX mathematical expressions needed to be converted to visual elements in PowerPoint.

# LaTeX ‚Üí Standalone document ‚Üí DVI ‚Üí PNG ‚Üí PowerPoint
latex_eq = "E = mc^2"
# 1. Create standalone LaTeX document
# 2. Compile to DVI using latex command
# 3. Convert DVI to PNG using dvipng (300 DPI, white background)
# 4. Cache result in .equation_cache/ for reuse
: Use LaTeX‚Äôs own rendering engine for perfect mathematical typesetting, then convert to raster format for PowerPoint compatibility.
: LaTeX Beamer documents have structural elements (title slides, outlines) that weren‚Äôt being recognized.
: Parse document structure, not just content. Understand the semantic meaning of LaTeX commands.
: Different PowerPoint templates use different placeholder type numbers, causing content to appear in wrong locations.

# Check both type and name for robustness
is_body_placeholder = (
    placeholder.placeholder_format.type == 1 or  # Body placeholder
    'content' in placeholder.name.lower() or
    'body' in placeholder.name.lower()
)
is_title_placeholder = (
    placeholder.placeholder_format.type == 0 or  # Title placeholder
    'title' in placeholder.name.lower()
)
: Don‚Äôt rely on single criteria. Use multiple detection methods for cross-template compatibility.
: Layout calculations in mapper, rendering in builder
: Pass source context through the conversion chain
: Cache parsed documents and position calculations
: Render LaTeX math as images or text
: Comprehensive coverage of all core components
: Manifest-based testing with 17 test files covering:
: Title slides, table of contents, metadata extraction

tests/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ parsers/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test_latex_parser.py (basic parsing)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test_latex_parser_structure.py (structural features)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test_latex_parser_data_driven.py (manifest-based)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test_data/ (17 comprehensive test files)
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ basic/ (simple frames)
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ equations/ (mathematical content)
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ formatting/ (text and lists)
‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ complex/ (tables, figures, nesting)
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ edge_cases/ (special characters, Unicode)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ builders/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test_powerpoint_builder.py (PowerPoint generation)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ models/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test_universal.py (data models)
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test_core.py (integration testing)
The current architecture has proven effective for basic LaTeX to PowerPoint conversion. The key success factors are:
: Graceful degradation when things go wrong
The system is now ready for Phase 2 enhancements while maintaining the solid foundation established in Phase 1.
